headline.main: Living With Cancer: For the Birds

docs.abstract: At times, I have to admit, there is absolutely no response to my cancer that seems acceptable to me, probably because the cancer isn’t.
docs.snippet: At times, I have to admit, there is absolutely no response to my cancer that seems acceptable to me, probably because the cancer isn’t.

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal Medicare agency had not clearly defined “conflict of interest” and did not enforce standards to prevent such conflicts from influencing coverage decisions, according to a new report.

headline.seo: Lax Policing of Doctor and Pharmacy Conflicts Is Found in Medicare Coverage Decisions
headline.main: Lax Policing of Doctor and Pharmacy Conflicts Is Found in Medicare Coverage Decisions
headline.print_headline: Lax Policing of Doctor and Pharmacy Conflicts Is Found in Medicare Coverage Decisions

docs.abstract: Report from Health and Human Services inspector general Daniel R Levinson says Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services has not clearly defined 'conflict of interest' among doctors and pharmacists and does not enforce standards meant to prevent such conflicts from influencing coverage decisions.
docs.snippet: The federal Medicare agency had not clearly defined “conflict of interest” and did not enforce standards to prevent such conflicts from influencing coverage decisions, according to a new report.

keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Is the United States-Mexico border better secured than it used to be? Answering this question is complex, and it largely depends on which stretch of the border you consider.

headline.seo: Border Security: Hard to Achieve, and Harder to Measure

docs.abstract: Challenge to stop illegal immigration from Mexico into the United States has tied Congress in knots for decades, and as lawmakers in Washington pursue a sweeping overhaul of immigration law, the country is again debating what to do about border security; what remains unclear is the meaning of a secure border, how to measure it and what are reasonable expectations given the cost and challenges (Series: Watching The Line)
docs.snippet: Is the United States-Mexico border better secured than it used to be? Answering this question is complex, and it largely depends on which stretch of the border you consider.

byline.contributor: Robert Gebeloff contributed reporting from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: A large genetic study has identified common glitches involved in schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, autism, major depression and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

headline.seo: Study Finds Genetic Risk Factors Shared by 5 Psychiatric Disorders
headline.main: 5 Disorders Share Genetic Risk Factors, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: 5 Disorders Share Genetic Risk Factors, Study Finds

docs.abstract: Study published online in journal Lancet identifies several common genetic glitches that can nudge brain along path to schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, autism, major depression and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder; authors of study say it is largest genetic study yet of psychiatric disorders, and involved examination of genetic data of more than 60,000 people worldwide.
docs.snippet: A large genetic study has identified common glitches involved in schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, autism, major depression and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.
